author: Staff Reporter
text:
Even as the Chinnamanur branch of Madurai District Central Cooperative Bank branch distributed application forms free of cost for an interest-free loan to small traders under Amma Small Traders’ Loan Assistance Scheme, local agents near the bank have started selling photocopies of forms to the public at Rs.10 each here on Thursday.

The photocopies of application forms were being sold in large numbers before the bank.

When contacted, the bank staff said that original application forms with an official seal was given to eligible applicants.

But photocopies of applications were also found in the bunch of applications received by it.

“We will have to check all applications.”

They appealed to the borrowers not to pay any amount for the applications and depend on middlemen for getting loans, they advised.

Chief Minister J. Jayalalitha launched the scheme recently under which bankers would offer Rs.5,000 as an interest-free loan. They would repay the principal amount in 25 weeks on a weekly instalment of Rs.200.
title: Middlemen sell photocopies of loan applications for Rs.10
